techmeme.title: Mitre, the nonprofit research organization behind the CVE program, says the US government funding needed to develop and operate CVE will expire on April 16 (David DiMolfetta/Nextgov/FCW)
OpenAI is adding an image library to ChatGPT to make it easier for users to access their AI-generated images, rolling out to all Free, Plus, and Pro users (Jay Peters/The Verge)
Google plans to redirect all Search users to google.com over the coming months, saying "country-level domains are no longer necessary" (Abner Li/9to5Google)
Filing: Nvidia says it will record a $5.5B charge after the US said it would require a license to export the H20 chips to China; NVDA drops 6%+ after hours (CNBC)
Sources: Meta offered $450M in late March to settle the FTC's antitrust case and raised its offer to ~$1B as the trial neared; the FTC had demanded $30B (Wall Street Journal)
